trans-unit.source: Service-side authorization of users in a JavaScript backend mobile service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Service-side authorization of users in a JavaScript backend mobile service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authorize users in JavaScript backend of Azure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authorize users in JavaScript backend of Azure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Service-side authorization of users in Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Service-side authorization of users in Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use server-side scripts to authorize users.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use server-side scripts to authorize users.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you register scripts with Azure Mobile Services, filter queries based on user IDs, and give users access to only their own data.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you register scripts with Azure Mobile Services, filter queries based on user IDs, and give users access to only their own data.

trans-unit.source: Filtering a user's query results by the user ID is the most basic form of authorization.
trans-unit.target: Filtering a user's query results by the user ID is the most basic form of authorization.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your specific scenario, you might also want to create Users or Roles tables to track more detailed user authorization information, such as which endpoints a given user is permitted to access.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your specific scenario, you might also want to create Users or Roles tables to track more detailed user authorization information, such as which endpoints a given user is permitted to access.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services Quick Start and builds on the [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services Quick Start and builds on the [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Please complete [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] first.
trans-unit.target: Please complete [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] first.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register scripts
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register scripts

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click on your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click on your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Data tab, then click the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Click the Data tab, then click the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Click Script, select the Insert operation, replace the existing script with the following function, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Script, select the Insert operation, replace the existing script with the following function, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: This script adds the user ID of the authenticated user to the item before insertion.
trans-unit.target: This script adds the user ID of the authenticated user to the item before insertion.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that <link><linkText>dynamic schema</linkText><title></title></link> is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that <link><linkText>dynamic schema</linkText><title></title></link> is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the userId column is not added automatically.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the userId column is not added automatically.

trans-unit.source: This setting is enabled by default for a new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This setting is enabled by default for a new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, replace the existing Read operation with the following function.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, replace the existing Read operation with the following function.

trans-unit.source: This script filters returned TodoItem objects so that a user receives only the items that they insert themselves.
trans-unit.target: This script filters returned TodoItem objects so that a user receives only the items that they insert themselves.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test the app

trans-unit.source: Notice that when you now run your client-side app, although there are items already in the TodoItem table from previous tutorials, no items are returned.
trans-unit.target: Notice that when you now run your client-side app, although there are items already in the TodoItem table from previous tutorials, no items are returned.

trans-unit.source: This happens because previous items were inserted without the user ID column and now have null values.
trans-unit.target: This happens because previous items were inserted without the user ID column and now have null values.

trans-unit.source: Verify newly added items have an associated userId value in the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Verify newly added items have an associated userId value in the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: If you have additional login accounts, verify that users can only see their own data by closing and deleting the app and running it again.
trans-unit.target: If you have additional login accounts, verify that users can only see their own data by closing and deleting the app and running it again.

trans-unit.source: When the login credentials dialog is displayed, enter a different login and verify that items entered under the previous login are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: When the login credentials dialog is displayed, enter a different login and verify that items entered under the previous login are not displayed.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
